page.title: 01Eastchurch Isle of Sheppey
page.content: This block consists of a large percentage of{farming}land,the northern coastline of the Isle of Sheppey and the village of Eastchurch. Much of the residential area is taken up with{caravan and chalet parks mainly used during the summer season. A feature of the area is the {historic building}of Shurland Hall,a ruin from the Tudor period.One of the large farms,Norwood Manor,dates back to the Medieval period.In more recent times the land has been divided into smaller units and farmed. {Erosion}is a recurrent feature of the northern coastline.The highest part of the island at sixty nine metres is The Mount, the site of the island's water tower.
